job_description: Data Scientist - job post Caris Life Sciences Irving, TX 75039 You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Position Summary Caris Life Sciences is seeking a creative, driven, and goal-oriented data scientist to join their R&D team. This position will be responsible for developing machine learning algorithms using NGS and histopathology image features to predict biomarkers, as well as designing and implementing analytic pipelines to support Caris' research initiatives. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a solid scientific background, and excellent communication abilities. They should also have a passion for personalized medicine and be committed to staying up to date with the latest developments in machine learning technology. Additionally, there will be opportunities to publish research results and contribute to Caris' ongoing innovation efforts. Job Responsibilities Analyze large data sets generated from NGS and histopathology images to predict biomarkers for cancer diagnosis, prognosis, and treatment. Developing, implementing, refining, and testing algorithms and workflows that achieve strategic goals in biomarker prediction, molecular profiling, and R&D objectives. Utilize statistical and machine learning methods to analyze and interpret complex data sets and drive insights. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including bioinformaticians, molecular biologists, and software engineers, to identify biomarkers and optimize algorithms. Developing state-of-the-art predictive models with both structured and unstructured data sets. Manipulate and process large multisource data sets. Respond to, and manage ad hoc requests to deliver accurate, in-depth results/data, in a timely matter. Adhere to coding and documentation standards and manage deliverables for areas of responsibility. Required Qualifications PhD in Data Science, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with exposure to cancer biology. Ability to understand biological/pathology questions and formulate novel statistical and algorithmic solutions to challenging problems. Proficiency in Python or R; Python preferred. Familiar with Linux environment and git. Ability to query complex data from databases, both relational and non-relational (SQL and noSQL). Demonstrated ability to apply data science and machine learning techniques across various data types and determine the most effective methods for each task. Experience with end-to-end data science workflows. Strong analytics mindset and familiarity with NGS, histopathology, and cancer biology. Experience working with biomedical imaging. Experience with histopathology scanned slides is a plus. Proficient verbal and written communication skills to explain complex technical details in clear language. Conditions of Employment: Individuals must successfully complete pre-employment process, which includes criminal background check, drug screening, and reference verification. Physical Demands Will work at a computer most of the time, with some time spent collaborating with subject matter experts and business group leaders either in person or through remote conferencing Training All job-specific, safety, and compliance training are assigned based on the job functions associated with this employee. This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Caris Life Sciences is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.
